result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Natron M Butler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Natron M Butler appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Natron M Butler.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant requests to be in person for his plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Natron M Butler in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial. Discussions with parties. Defense counsel advises that there has been a change in circumstances and the parties are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing Hearing to Br 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Natron M Butler in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final pre-trial held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 8/8/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.

Defendant Natron M Butler in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Natron M Butler in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Natron M Butler in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Plaisted, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/30/2022 IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAJ.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Natron M Butler in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Natron M Butler
Current: 5008 N 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-28-2022)
Prior: 2472 North Dousman Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22  @ 2p
